artist: Artist: Natori Shunsen; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: unsigned; man with painted face; curly hair; multicolored costume; lifting straw hat off his head
markings: red artist\'s seal: 春仙 {Shunsen}; LLC, artist\'s hand-applied red approval seal: 名取 {Natori}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
portfolio: From Creative Prints: Collected Portraits by Shunsen (Sōsaku hanga: Shunsen nigao-e shū 創作版画　春仙似顔画集)
text: Seventeenth design of a set of 36. Based on Ichikawa Chūsha VII as Akechi Jūbei Mitsuhide in the scene Amagasaki kankyo of the play Ehon Taikōki 絵本太功記　尼ヶ崎閑居 (The picture book of the Taikō), performed at the Kabuki Theater, May 1919.
title: Actor Ichikawa Chūsha VII as Takechi Mitsuhide
